title: As a user I want to remove a player from a Post Season roster in the Roster Management utility
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
http://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=roster_management

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Once a Post Season roster has been loaded in the utility, there is a trash can icon next to each player listed. 
* Clicking the trash can will remove the associated player from the roster. 
* This removal will not be stored unless the roster is Saved or Submitted or Approved.

title: As a user I want to save a Post Season roster in the Roster Management utility
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
http://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=roster_management

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a Post Season roster is loaded in the roster management utility there is a Save button present for both BOC and Club users.
* Clicking "Save" will Save the roster as it is currently displayed in the utility. 
* A blue successful save notification should display.

title: As a Club user I want to Submit a Post Season roster
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
http://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=roster_management

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a Post Season roster is loaded in the roster management utility there is a Submit button present for Club users.
* Clicking "Submit" will Save the roster as it is currently displayed in the utility. 
* A blue successful submit notification should display. 
* An approvals item is generated for the BOC. The From Org should be the submitting Org. The description should read "Major League special roster (DS) has been submitted.â€￾ with the portion in parenthesis being replaced with the abbreivation of the corresponding special roster. 
  - Division Series - DS
  - World Series - WS 
  - Wild Card - WC
  - League Championship Series - LCS

title: As a user I want to see an error if I attempt to Save a Post Season roster that has already been approved
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
http://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=roster_management

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Roster+Management+-+Messages

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Clicking "Submit" or "Save" as a Club user, or "Approve" or "Save" as a BOC user will check to see if the roster currently displayed has already been approved.
* If yes, then an error is displayed. See Messages #1.

title: As a user I want to see a warning if I attempt to Save a Post Season roster that has already been saved
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
http://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=roster_management

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Roster+Management+-+Messages

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Clicking "Submit" or "Save" as a Club user, or "Approve" or "Save" as a BOC user will check to see if the roster currently displayed has already been saved.
* If yes, then an error is displayed. See Messages #2.

title: As a BOC user I want to see an updated Roster Management utility
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
http://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=roster_management

Acceptance Criteria: 
* The Roster Management tab should be renamed to "Special Rosters" and moved to appear under the "Rosters" dashboard. 
* The Roster Management utility should be updated so that the first choice is "Roster Type" (formerly named Save Roster As).
* The options that are currently there should remain, and have a few added so that the list is: 
 - Labor Joint Exhibit (current)
 - Opening Day (current)
 - Post Season Eligibility (current)
 - Reserve List (current)
 - Foreign Opener (current)
 - Division Series (new) 
 - Wild Card (new) 
 - League Championship Series (new) 
 - World Series (new)

title: As a user I want to see a preliminary Post Season roster in the Roster Management utility
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
http://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=roster_management

Acceptance Criteria: 
* If "Roster Type" is set to one of the following options:
 - Division Series 
 - Wild Card  
 - League Championship Series  
 - World Series 
* Then an "Org" filter will be available that contains the 30 Orgs (for BOC). 
* Selecting an Org will populate the utility in the following manner: 
  - Check for an existing saved roster for the specified year, roster type and org
     - If no saved roster exists, load existing Post Season Eligibility roster for year and org
     - If no Post Season Eligibility roster exists for the specified year and org, load the 40-man roster for the specified org
 - Load any comments saved with the roster
* Sorted by Last, Roster First. 
* Names displayed as Last, Roster First. 
* Nothing is stored at this time.

title: As a Club user I want to see the Roster Management utility
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
http://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=roster_management

Acceptance Criteria: 
* The Roster Management utility is currently a BOC only utility and is controlled by the ebis-roster-management-editors LDAP. We need to adjust this so that we can display this for the BOC as well as Clubs (can create a new LDAP or just use Org to control it). 
* Club users with this permission should see the utility as an option under "Rosters" dashboard as "Special Rosters", but they should only be able to see the following Roster Types:
 - Division Series  
 - Wild Card  
 - League Championship Series  
 - World Series 
* They should not be allowed to change the Org - it should be defaulted to their own Org.

title: As a user I want to add a player to a Post Season roster in the Roster Management utility
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
http://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=roster_management

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Once a Post Season roster has been loaded in the utility, there is an Add Player button. 
* Clicking the Add Player button will add a row to the utility with a searchable dropdown where the user has a chance to select a player. 
* Player list contains: 
  - players whoâ€™s (org or pending org matches the selected org)
  - AND (employee type is null or employee type = â€˜Field Personnelâ€™)
  - AND SHOWONROSTER_FLG = 1 (player is currently on a roster)
* This addition will not be stored unless the roster is Saved or Submitted. Once they are stored, they should look the same as any of the other players that were added by default, and sorted in the list appropriately. 
* Save, Approve and Submit buttons are disabled until a player is selected in the row.

title: As a BOC user I want to Approve a Post Season roster
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
http://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=roster_management

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a Post Season roster is loaded in the roster management utility there is an Approve button present for BOC users.
* Clicking "Approve" will Save the roster as it is currently displayed in the utility, and flag the current year's special roster as approved.
* If an approvals item exists for this roster, it is dismissed. 
* A blue successful approve notification should display. 
* A notification is generated for all Orgs. The From Org should be the Org. The description should read "Major League special roster (DS) has been approved.â€￾ with the portion in parenthesis being replaced with the abbreivation of the corresponding special roster. 
  - Division Series - DS
  - World Series - WS 
  - Wild Card - WC
  - League Championship Series - LCS

title: As a BOC user I do not want to see a checkbox on the pending approvals widget for special rosters
custom_expected:
THEN
* BOC users do not see a checkbox on Approvals items for Post Season roster submissions.

title: As a user I want to be able to run the Post Season Eligibility Roster Report
custom_preconds:
Report Layout: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Post+Season+Eligibility+Roster+Report+Layout

Report Details: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Post+Season+Eligibility+Roster+Report+Details

Report Logic: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=116198866

Report Prompts: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Post+Season+Eligibility+Roster+Report+Prompts

Acceptance Criteria: 
* "Post Season Eligibility Roster" is a report in the Report listing widget. Selecting this report from the widget will launch the prompts according to the requirements. 
* The category of this report should be "Rosters". 
* Entering the desired prompts and running the report will work and match the requirements. 
* The report will have an LDAP associated with it. Please provide the LDAP when the story is delivered and a user id to test the report and security with.
